prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
	diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(readxl)
library(limma)
library(ggplot2)

# Read the count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx", col_names = TRUE)

# Read the annotation data
annotation_data <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)

# Extract the sample names from the annotation data
sample_names <- rownames(annotation_data)

# Set the row names of the count table to the gene names
rownames(count_table) <- count_table$Genes
count_table <- count_table[, -1]

# Filter the count table to include only the samples present in the annotation data
count_table <- count_table[, sample_names]

# Convert the count table to a numeric matrix
count_matrix <- as.matrix(count_table)

# Perform statistical tests to find genes specific for each group using limma
group_specific_genes <- rowttests(count_matrix, factor(annotation_data$group))$ID

# Subset the count table to include only the group specific genes
count_table_group_specific <- count_table[group_specific_genes, ]

# Perform PCA using the group specific genes
pca <- prcomp(t(count_table_group_specific))

# Create a data frame for the PCA results
pca_results <- data.frame(PC1 = pca$x[,1], PC2 = pca$x[,2], Group = annotation_data$group)

# Plot PCA colored by group
ggplot(pca_results, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = Group)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "PCA Plot", x = "PC1", y = "PC2") +
  theme_minimal()
```

Note: Make sure to update the file paths in the code to match the location of your files.
